newsitem.title: FRANCE: France's Tapie transferred to jail near ill father.
newsitem.headline: France's Tapie transferred to jail near ill father.

text.p: Bankrupt French businessman and ex-soccer boss Bernard Tapie, serving an eight-month jail term for rigging a soccer game, was transferred from Paris on Friday to a prison in southern France closer to his ailing father.

Tapie, once a cabinet minister in a Socialist-led government, arrived by prison van at the Luynes jail in the Bouches-du-Rhone department near the constituency that used to elect him to parliament, prison officials said.

Jailed at Paris' La Sante prison since February 3 when the last of his legal appeals failed, the former chairman of Marseille soccer club requested the transfer after his father suffered a heart attack.
He will need special permission to visit his father.

Tapie was sentenced to jail for his role in bribing Valenciennes players to lose a key league match against Marseille in 1993 and give his players an easy game days before they played the European Cup final against AC Milan.
Marseille went on to beat AC Milan, 1-0.
